message: Debbie and I want to wish you and your family a safe and blessed 2017! We are so thankful to live in a country where we have so much to hope for and aspire to in the coming year. May God bless you, and #HappyNewYear!

Humbled and privileged to begin serving #NC11 this week in the 115th Congress. We have a long road ahead and there is much work to be done, but I'm optimistic and truly believe that the best days of America are ahead.  To the great people of Western NC--thank you for giving me this opportunity. My voting card will always belong to you.

Americans have been told lie after lie about #Obamacare. Here are just a few:  - Obamacare was supposed to reduce health insurance premiums of Americans $2500 per family per year (premiums rising by an average of over 22% across the country.)  - "If you like your doctor, you can keep your doctor."  - "If you like your healthcare plan, you can keep it."  - Obamacare supposedly would not "add one dime to the deficit" (it is consistently projected to add over 6 trillion to the long term deficit.)  Obamacare represents 6 years of misguided policy, broken promises, and failed results. Americans deserve better. This law should be fully repealed.

Thanks to Senator Rand Paul for meeting with the House Freedom Caucus today -- discussing solutions to healthcare reform and our budget deficit. Great to work with a man who has consistently demonstrated such a strong commitment to upholding conservative principles and values.  (Photo credit to the gentleman from Michigan, Rep. Justin Amash).

The most effective way to grow our economy: simplify the tax code, reduce #taxes, and unlock the potential of American workers and business.  Watch the video below to see my interview on Fox Business, discussing our new Congress' goal of reforming our tax system and lifting the crushing burden of government off of working families.
Happy birthday to one of the truly finest places in the country, the City of Hendersonville, NC -- turning 170 this week!  Hendersonville, NC City Government

Today is Law Enforcement Appreciation Day (L.E.A.D. Day)! Thank you to the men and women in blue who lay their lives on the line every day to protect us--especially the officers of #NC11, the best in the country.  We often forget how much we rely on these men and women until we're in need. On a day like today, if you see a police officer, be sure to thank them!

#Obamacare is the first big test of this new Congress, and we have an obligation to act now, to act thoroughly, and to act swiftly. Republicans have promised to repeal Obamacare over the last 3 elections. It’s time to deliver on serious, patient-centered healthcare reform that will provide Americans with real options at affordable costs.   Great to join my friend Shannon Bream with Fox News yesterday to talk about repealing and replacing Obamacare.

The facts are clear: #Obamacare has had disastrous effects on our #economy and #healthcare system. This law needs to be repealed and replaced both quickly and effectively, and it needs to be done in this Congress--not kicked down the road to the future, as #Congress so often does.  Too often, Congress takes a defeatist attitude before we even begin a job. At this moment, it's critical that we take on a much more aggressive, ‘get to work’ mindset when it comes to keeping our promises--particularly in the area of healthcare reform and repealing Obamacare. That's our job. That's what we were sent here to do.  I spoke with Peter Alexander on "Meet the Press Daily" about this issue.

Republicans in #Congress have rightfully criticized the excessive spending habits of the Obama Administration these last 8 years. For us to bring back earmarks now would send the wrong message. It cannot happen.  It's time for Congress to restore order and use its power over the purse for its rightful purpose: to rein in our out-of-control government and bureaucracy.  My interview on Your World with Neil Cavuto:
Op-ed with my House Freedom Caucus colleague, Jim Jordan: "No more excuses, Republicans." It's time to keep our promises and do the bold things that the American people sent us here to do.

1. Repeal #ObamaCare in its entirety and replace it with a market-based solution that drives down costs and allows consumer choice. And don’t take three years to do it.  2. Secure our border. We are a nation of laws and we must end the free flow of illegal immigration into the United States. #Congress must also immediately deport criminal illegal immigrants and cut funding to sanctuary cities and sanctuary campuses.  3. Put in place an immediate halt on refugees from terrorist hotspots until we are able to reform our vetting system to ensure no threat is posed to the homeland.  4. Provide our #military the support and direction it needs from Congress to ensure we are prepared for threats both abroad and domestically.  5. Implement #welfare reform that helps the truly needy but requires able-bodied adults to work.  6. Pass tax reform legislation that simplifies the tax code, incentivizes businesses to operate in the U.S., and eases the burden on working families.  7. Lift job-killing #regulations put in place under the Obama administration.   8. Stand up for religious liberty and protect the sanctity of life. Congress should defund Planned Parenthood and pass the First Amendment Defense Act, which protects religious liberty.  9. Reaffirm our commitment to our allies abroad, especially to our great ally Israel.  10. Remember, there is a $20 trillion #debt that must be addressed.  ICYMI: My op-ed with Rep. Jim Jordan. No more excuses, Republicans. Let's get the job done.
Best wishes to my friend Dr. Dan Lunsford, Mars Hill University President, on his upcoming retirement. Dr. Lunsford is one of the best.

Flawed. Failing. Not fixable.  These are just a few of the words to describe #Obamacare--our crumbling healthcare system that is hurting working families, bankrupting businesses, and driving our economy into the ground. This law needs to be fully repealed. Americans cannot afford to bear the burden of its failure any longer.  While Republicans continue to debate how to best repeal and replace Obamacare, we agree on the big picture: our current system does not work and is unacceptable.  While serious concerns remain, I have been pleased to hear the Speaker commit to bringing up a healthcare replacement bill within days, not weeks, of a repeal measure. This has been a top priority of mine and the Freedom Caucus’, as I believe it is critical that we give the American people a clear direction and assurance of a smooth transition toward a sound, high quality, and affordable healthcare market—especially so the most vulnerable can get the coverage they need.   Going forward, I strongly believe and will continue to express that a full repeal of Obamacare should take effect within two years during the 115th Congress. That is what we promised the voters we would do. That is our job--and it’s high time we accomplish it.  https://meadows.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/rep-meadows-statement-on-obamacare-repeal
"The time is always right to do what is right."  Thank you, Dr. King. #MLKDay

Within hours of inauguration this Friday, President-elect Trump and Republicans in Congress will be ready to get to work immediately and begin rolling back the out-of-control bureaucracy in Washington.
Last night I had the opportunity to join The Daily Caller for a Facebook Live event--talking Obamacare repeal, the upcoming inauguration, and more.
Debbie and I have really enjoyed seeing so many of you in town for inauguration this weekend. Looking forward to the celebration tomorrow!

I’m very confident that business as usual in Washington ended today.   Today we saw the culmination of millions of Americans standing up and speaking out that they are tired of watching their government encroach further into their lives with higher taxes, increased regulations, and out-of-control spending.   I want to offer my congratulations to our newly inaugurated President, Donald J. #Trump, and our Vice President, Mike #Pence. I look forward to working with the President and his team as we hit the ground running on the most productive first 100 days in modern history--giving relief to so many Americans who have felt the crushing burden of these last eight years. Let’s get to work. #Inauguration

President Trump just signed an executive order that reinstates a policy called the "Mexico City Policy"-- a policy that restricts foreign, non-governmental organizations that receive U.S. aid from performing abortion services or promoting abortion overseas. This is a reversal of an executive action by President Obama.  As Washington, D.C. prepares to host hundreds of thousands of marchers in the #MarchForLife—the largest annual peaceful protest in D.C.—it is very fitting that President Trump began the week with this executive order.   Taxpayer funding should never be used to fund #abortion services or promotion. I’m thrilled to see the #Trump administration begin a new dawn of government with a firm commitment to the sanctity of #life. #MexicoCityPolicy

This morning I was privileged to gavel in the House of Representatives -- on the first official work day of the new #Trump Administration.  This is an exciting new dawn for our government. We're already hitting the ground running.  It's time to deliver. Let's get to work.
President #Trump made an outstanding choice in Mike Pompeo for #CIA Director--I'm thrilled to see him confirmed. He'll do a tremendous job.

Be sure to tune in to Sean Hannity this evening on Fox News!   This afternoon I'm sitting down with Sean, along with Reps. Louie Gohmert, Marsha Blackburn, Rep. Scott Perry, and Jim Jordan --talking President #Trump's agenda and the steps we're taking to keep our promises to the American people.  The interview will air tonight! Tune in!

Many of you are probably familiar with my friend and House Freedom Caucus colleague, Mick Mulvaney (R-SC).  But if you haven't had the chance to read about him, I'd encourage you to do so. Mick is one of the sharpest, most principled friends I've come to know in Congress. He would be a phenomenal budget chief for our country--especially given the critical financial crossroads our government is facing.

If you didn't get a chance to tune in, you can watch last night's interview with Sean Hannity on Fox News here -- featuring my friends Reps. Louie Gohmert, Marsha Blackburn, Scott Perry, and Jim Jordan.   The bottom line: it's time to do what we told the voters we would do. What we need to be about right now is a 100% commitment to keeping our promises to the American people, even if it sends us home.  The first week is off to a good start! Let's keep moving forward.

I'm humbled to continue serving Western North Carolina as the Chairman of the Subcommittee on Government Operations.  We will never let up in our mission--to ensure that federal agencies are open and transparent in their execution of federal law.

Great news -- this is a promising first step toward securing our border, solving our immigration crisis, and keeping Americans safe.  Republicans have campaigned on border security for years. It’s high time we kept our promise. I applaud President Trump for acting on his commitments and keeping the security of the American people a top priority.

#TBT to last year's #MarchForLife--the largest annual peaceful protest in DC--taking place again tomorrow, January 27th!  What a privilege to take part and stand for protecting the unborn. Looking forward to seeing everyone tomorrow!

What we’re seeing from President #Trump is something that voters across America have wanted for so long – someone who actually does what the voters sent them to Washington to do.  It was great to join my friend Greta Van Susteren on her new show -- For the Record -- at MSNBC!

Honored to stand for life today at The March for Life with so many friends and colleagues. Pictured with Rep. Mia Love, Sen. Joni Ernst, Author Eric Metaxas, Rep. Robert Aderholt, my wife Debbie, and Caroline Aderholt. May we never forget that life is precious!  #ProLife #MarchForLife
"Endowed by (our) Creator with certain unalienable Rights, that among these are Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of Happiness."  #MarchForLife #ProLife The March for Life

Outstanding news: President #Trump just signed an executive order taking a major step toward reducing regulations. For every new regulation introduced, two must be revoked.  I applaud President Trump for his commitment to roll back the regulatory state. Americans are most successful when #Washington gets out of the way and allows everyday people to create their own path to success without the constant roadblock of government bureaucracy.

I'm very pleased with President Donald J. Trump's nomination for Supreme Court--Judge Neil Gorsuch. While I haven't had the chance to meet him, every indication about Judge Gorsuch is that he is a brilliant, principled man who deeply respects our #Constitution and will put the rule of law first. Those are exactly the type of qualities we need in men and women who sit on the highest Court in our land.  Once again, President #Trump has proven that he is serious about keeping his commitments to the American people.

Members of the House Freedom Caucus just finished meeting with Dr. and Senator Rand Paul--discussing solutions to repeal and replace #Obamacare. We're committed to giving Americans relief from this broken system and pushing real reform that allows for access to affordable #healthcare for all!

"In our legal order, it is for Congress--not the Courts--to write new laws. It the role of judges to apply--not alter--the work of the people's representatives." -Judge Neil #Gorsuch, nominee for Supreme Court.  This perspective on the balance between #Congress and the courts is all too refreshing--President #Trump made an outstanding choice. I applaud him and his team.

My colleague Rep. Jim Jordan and I have released the following statement on #Obamacare repeal:  "Health care will be better and more affordable once Obamacare is repealed. We committed to the American people to repeal every tax, every mandate, the regulations, and to defund Planned Parenthood. That’s what the American people expect us to do – and they expect us to do it quickly.   Therefore we strongly encourage Republican leadership on Capitol Hill to take up the Affordable Care Act repeal bill that already passed the House, the Senate, and went to President Obama’s desk in early 2016. There’s no reason we should put anything less on President Trump’s desk than we put on President Obama’s now that we know it will be signed into law. We strongly encourage that this bill be brought to the floor for consideration as soon as possible so we can begin undoing this law that is hurting American families."

When it comes to repealing #Obamacare, there is no reason Republicans should put anything less on President #Trump’s desk than we put on President #Obama’s--especially now that we know it will be signed into law.  In 2016, Republicans passed Obamacare repeal language that would have done away with the taxes, mandates, and regulations that have crushed working families--had President Obama not vetoed the bill. There is no reason we should pass a weaker, more watered-down bill now with President Trump in office. None.  The House Freedom Caucus has been in active discussions with Senator Rand Paul and other lawmakers to help develop patient centered, conservative healthcare reform that will allow for access to quality, affordable healthcare for Americans. Keep an eye out for more developments in the coming days.  Let's be bold. Let's hold each other to the promises we made to the American people, because we owe them nothing less. Let's get this done.
"The (#Obamacare) repeal that passed last year under a Democrat president should be the bare minimum members of Congress should pass under President Donald J. Trump."

At airport screening, a TSA agents stops me and says--   "Tell President Donald J. Trump that we may not break windows or throw things, but we do have his back."
Congratulations to Nathan Mahoney on achieving the rank of Eagle Scout--it was an honor to be there this weekend at his ceremony! Nathan is an outstanding young man.

This weekend I was honored to recognize the service of local legend, Mickey Marvin, by presenting a Congressional Record to Inez Taylor and Jonathan Marvin--Mickey's mother and son.   For those of you who don't know him, it would be difficult to do justice to what Mickey means to our community. He has been a cornerstone of Henderson County for years with his involvement--including working with youth camps, getting involved in local churches, and founding Mickey Marvin Scholarship Fund to benefit local athletes.   Thank you, Mickey! Your willingness to serve is an example to us all.

Years later, we are still inspired by his principled leadership, his quick witted humor, and his unwavering commitment to America and her people.  Happy birthday, President #Reagan! #HappyBirthdayReagan

It is critically important we deliver on the promises we made to the American people--repeal the broken system of #Obamacare, and replace it with a system that protects the most vulnerable and allows for access to affordable coverage for all Americans.
Going on now! I encourage everyone to tune in--there are few better advocates for conservative principles than my friend Ted Cruz. Looking forward to hearing what he has to say.
Live with my colleague Jim Jordan -- discussing #Obamacare repeal and #healthcare reform with The Daily Signal.

This week the House Freedom Caucus met with Ways and Means Committee Chairman Kevin Brady, and we're hopeful that we'll have a #taxreform bill to vote on by this summer.   This is significant. Higher #taxes have been a tough burden for families across American to bear, and we're excited to pass a bill that will simplify our #tax code, cut taxes, and allow you--not bureaucrats in DC-- to make more decisions with your own hard-earned money.

Today, I joined my colleagues Rep. Jim Jordan and United States Senator Mike Lee in a press availability session to talk about where we stand on #Obamacare repeal.   I'm grateful for Conservative colleagues like these two men who share in the commitment to repeal this broken law and replace it with a fiscally responsible system that 1) protects the most vulnerable, and 2) allows for access to affordable coverage for all Americans.
Very excited to see this--Congratulations to my friend Dr. Price. He is truly one of the best. Looking forward to working with him on reforming our broken healthcare system.

When we started the House Freedom Caucus two years ago, our goal was to give a voice to countless Americans who feel that #Washington does not represent them.  Now, our message is growing--and every day we are more committed to helping make Washington a place for open, accountable and limited #government. We have a lot of work ahead but we're encouraged by the momentum so far.

I want to thank everyone for the feedback that we've received on #healthcare reform to this point. It's been very helpful.  To recap where I stand: I am committed to repealing #Obamacare, as I (and many other #Republicans) have promised to do for years. However, as I've stated before, I will not vote for any Obamacare replacement that neglects to deal with the issue of protecting those with pre-existing conditions. I'm committed to helping create an environment that protects the most vulnerable among us.  Watch my interview with CNN from this weekend to hear more.

Great to join my friend and North Carolina colleague, RSC Chairman Representative Mark Walker (R-NC), on C-SPAN's Washington Journal this morning--discussing the ongoing strategy to repeal and replace #Obamacare quickly and effectively.   The time for talk is over--we've been talking enough the last several years. It's now time to act and deliver on our promises.  If you didn't get a chance to tune in, watch below.

As a small business guy, I can tell you, the government never once created a job for me. Regulations from #Washington often have a chilling effect on business owners and job creation--not the other way around.  #Obamacare is a job killer--not a job creator. It's time to repeal and replace this broken law now.

BREAKING: In a press conference, the House Freedom Caucus just introduced an #Obamacare replacement plan--crafted by Congressman Mark Sanford and Senator Rand Paul.   The Freedom Caucus has taken an official position in support of this plan--focused on patient-centered care, more choice, protecting the most vulnerable, and fiscal responsibility.   I applaud my colleagues Senator Paul and Representative Sanford for their efforts in crafting this #healthcare reform bill. The need for fundamentally sound healthcare alternatives right now is absolutely critical--#Obamacare has been a disaster from the beginning, and Americans can no longer sustain the crushing weight of its failures.

Proud to stand with my House Freedom Caucus colleagues in officially supporting Senator Rand Paul and Congressman Mark Sanford's Obamacare replacement plan.   I commend Senator Paul and Rep. Sanford for crafting and releasing a plan so that we can move toward debating the issues at hand--and ultimately keep our promise to the people by repealing and replacing the destructive system of #Obamacare. This is a major step forward.

“Conservatives have come together to say that this is the replacement plan that we not only want to promote but debate and hopefully fine-tune.”  “This bill, like no other, empowers the consumer and emboldens the marketplace.”

This is fantastic news. The House’s loss is President Donald J. Trump's gain.   In my time serving in #Congress, Mick Mulvaney is truly one of the sharpest minds and most principled men I have come to know. His passion for his work and his relentless commitment to fiscal responsibility will make him a tremendous #OMB director. I’m proud to call him my friend. I congratulate Mick on his confirmation, and I commend President #Trump on his outstanding selection.

The House Freedom Caucus--thanks to the tireless efforts of Senator Rand Paul and Congressman Mark Sanford--has an #Obamacare replacement plan. A plan that's patient-centered, more affordable, and allows for the consumer to make the best choices for themselves--not government making the decisions for them.

"President #Trump, GOP #Congress have already cut $2.8 billion in regulations."  This is critical--reducing #regulations was desperately needed in our economy and business community. We're off to a strong start.

ICYMI: Our press conference from earlier this week, introducing the #Obamacare replacement bill from Sen. Rand Paul and Congressman Mark Sanford and announcing the support of the House Freedom Caucus.   A few principles from Senator Paul and Rep. Sanford:  1) The bill will legalize the sale of inexpensive #insurance by getting rid of mandates 2) The bill will expand options with Health Savings Accounts 3) It will allow individuals to join together in associations to buy insurance so they can gain leverage toward lower prices 4) It severs employment from health insurance, so you don't lose your health insurance if you lose your job 5) It allows those with pre-existing conditions a two-year period to sign up for health insurance with no penalty  The bottom line: Obamacare needs to be repealed now. As Rep. Jim Jordan often says, #healthcare will be better and more #affordable when Obamacare is gone. But it isn't enough just to say what we're against--we  need to say what we're for.
Wishing everyone a happy #PresidentsDay!

Debbie and I were very sad to have heard this news over the weekend--Theron was a dear, dear friend and a cornerstone of Henderson County for years. He was a man who always went above and beyond to pour himself out in service of those around him.  He will be missed. Sending prayers for his family.
Had a great time this morning joining my friends at WHKP 1450AM in studio!
Thanks to Western Carolina Community Action for having me this morning to read to the students of their 'Head Start' program! These kids are wonderful and have bright futures.

Thank you so much to everyone at Western Carolina Community Action for having me today! The teachers in this program are incredible and have such an enormous impact on the lives of these students--they are a vital part of our community. Thanks to them for all that they do.

The Affordable Care Act is not sustainable. This law is collapsing, and the time to repeal it is right now.   Congress should bring up the 2016 #repeal language that already passed through the #House and #Senate last year (when President Obama was in office) to repeal #Obamacare and then vote on a patient-centered replacement plan in the same week.   We voted to swiftly repeal this law when President #Obama was in the White House. There's no reason we should do less now that we have President #Trump. The American people have had it, and they want change.

Thanks to the great folks of Outrider USA in Fletcher, NC for having me for a visit yesterday! Outrider is a company that builds "ultralight pedal-electric trikes" for outdoor use. Be sure to visit their Facebook page and read more about their work! They represent some of the best of innovation in business.
No more excuses, #Republicans--we need to keep our promises and keep them now. It's about time #Congress got up to speed and matched the work ethic and resolve of President #Trump.
Debbie and I enjoyed seeing friends Dr. Jim and Shirley Dobson last night!
My friend and House Freedom Caucus colleague Jim Jordan talked about #Obamacare repeal and replacement this weekend on ABC News. I encourage you to watch the segment here.

Unless there are substantial changes to the #GOP #Obamacare repeal/replace bill that was leaked last week, I will vote against it.  When I ran for reelection last November, I made a promise to my constituents--a promise that I would fight for a full repeal of Obamacare, including every tax, every mandate, and every burdensome #regulation in this broken law.   I also committed to working toward a same-timeline vote on a fiscally responsible replacement plan that would protect the most vulnerable and allow families to have more control over their healthcare choices.   That's what I remain committed to, and I cannot settle for anything less. My constituents deserve nothing less.  I believe Obamacare should be repealed immediately. I also firmly disagree with the notion that we should replace it with elements that would be just as ineffective and just as expensive--or leave portions of the ACA in, giving people 'Obamacare Lite.' This would be wrong.  The time is now. Let's get this done. Let's actually do what we told the voters we would do.

Last night we saw something that Americans have been waiting on for a long time—a #President who is committed to delivering on his promises.   Yesterday, President Donald J. Trump outlined a clear vision for #America that is consistent with the message he has communicated from the beginning—a message that is built on the principles of reducing the size of #government, putting America first, and giving moms and dads on Main Street relief from an out of control bureaucratic state.  I commend the President for an outstanding speech focused on unifying Americans and moving our country forward. In the coming weeks, all of #Congress would do well to match the President's work ethic and focus on keeping the promises he made to the American people. We owe the voters nothing less.

It is critical that we fully repeal #Obamacare and essential that we get this right the first time. No partial repeal and partial replace--this whole law needs to go.   And what a refreshing reminder it was last night that we now have a President who is fully committed to the same principle!  Last night, after President #Trump's address to #Congress, I joined Sean #Hannity with some of my House Freedom Caucus colleagues-- Rep. Jim Jordan, Rep. Louie Gohmert, and Congressman Dave Brat from the rooftop across from the Capitol. Watch the full video below.
It was great to see my friend Speaker Gingrich last night on the set of #Hannity! The Speaker was as excited by President #Trump's address yesterday as the rest of us were.

When it comes to replacing #Obamacare, a new 'big spending' entitlement program with a #Republican package would be no better than what we've argued against for the last 8 years.   That's why we need to get this right the first time--with a plan that focuses on high quality patient care, allows families to have more flexibility, and empowers the individual to make their own choices at an affordable cost.   We're working hard to make it happen. Check out the details of Rep. Mark Sanford and Senator Rand Paul's replacement plan that we're supporting here: http://bit.ly/2lYcz10.

I joined Lou Dobbs on Fox Business last night to discuss why it's so critical that Republicans fully repeal #Obamacare and replace it with a patient centered, fiscally responsible alternative.  Read a section by section breakdown of our plan here: http://bit.ly/2m0MJrB

This week, some members of Team Meadows were able to volunteer for "Read Across America Day"! Wayne King, Clay McCreary, Jenny Maybin, and Jordan Whisnant were able to stop by some local schools and read to students--including Sawmills, Valmead, and Upward Elementary!

Glad to see my friend OMB Director Mick Mulvaney and President Donald J. Trump looking at #entitlement reform--I firmly believe we can keep our commitment to hard-working Americans who paid into these programs for years, while at the same time enacting real reforms that make the programs financially solvent for future generations.
Very sad to hear of Henderson County's own Mickey Marvin's passing. Mickey was one of the best--a true friend and role model to all those around him. Prayers for his family.

Op-ed with Senator Rand Paul: Let's fully repeal #Obamacare, then have an open debate on how to replace it.  We've got our plan ready. We’ll advocate for a free market plan that would lower cost and increase access for millions of Americans. The repeal we support has a time-frame to allow the market to work and ensure Americans don't lose coverage.  We would love to debate it and hear our colleagues’ amendments.

Last night, Rep. Louie Gohmert (R-TX) and I joined Sean #Hannity to discuss the newest #Obamacare replacement proposal.   We are urgently calling on our colleagues to keep the commitments made to the American people--lets push for a full repeal of Obamacare and do it now.

Conservatives in #Congress will not give in and support a plan that fails to fully repeal #Obamacare. We remain fully commitment to a clean and complete repeal of this broken law--followed by a replacement plan that actually brings insurance premium costs down.

As members of #Congress, I've found that we often make our jobs way too complicated. The job should be much simpler: do what we told the voters we would do.  While I have great respect for my colleagues that are willing to work on and share ideas for #healthcare reform, the #GOP leadership's #Obamacare replacement bill doesn't fit our job description. This plan isn't what we told the voters we would do.   I want to fully repeal Obamacare as much as (or more than) anyone--the #ACA is a disaster that needs to go. We committed to the voters that we would fully repeal it, and I believe we need to follow through on that promise now.  At the same time, attaching a so-called "repeal" to the passage of a new government entitlement program would be a critical mistake. All we would be doing is passing another big-spending, bureaucracy-centered healthcare plan under a #Republican name. That would be wrong.    We didn't tell the voters we would get rid of Obamacare but keep the taxes. We didn't tell them we'd repeal it but keep the mandates. We told the voters we would fully repeal this law. That's what we owe them. Nothing less.  Let’s fully repeal this law using the same bill we sent to President Obama in 2016, and immediately following, have an open and transparent debate on the three replacement plans that exist--voting on them within the same week. We owe it to the voters to do two things on healthcare:   1) Fully repeal #Obamacare -- every tax, every mandate, every regulation 2) Replace it with protections for the most vulnerable and free market policies that actually bring down premiums and healthcare costs for all Americans.  We have a plan--you can read the plan and our ideas behind it here     --> http://bit.ly/2lYcz10
Ted Cruz is right --> Republicans have a once in a lifetime opportunity to do what it right and help working families. Failure, or a job done 'halfway,' is not an option.

Enough with the broken promises and hedged commitments--Republicans have a responsibility to do exactly what we told the voters we would do on #Obamacare repeal. A plan that fails to do these things is not a plan that I can support. I discussed this with my friend Wolf Blitzer on CNN today. Watch below -->

Last night I spoke with Martha MacCallum on "The First 100 Days" about some goals for Conservatives in #healthcare reform. SOME NEWS: My colleagues and I in the House Freedom Caucus have announced an official position of support for a newly revised #Obamacare repeal bill.  You may remember over the past couple of months when I've announced that I would not be able to support the GOP's original version of the AHCA. I did not believe the original bill would bring down healthcare costs for Americans--particularly my constituents in WNC--and I've consistently said that I will not vote for any bill that fails to accomplish that purpose. House conservatives have worked tirelessly to improve the American Health Care Act (AHCA) to make it more beneficial for the American people. Due to improvements to the AHCA and the addition of an amendment from my friend Rep. Tom MacArthur (R-NJ), the House Freedom Caucus has taken an official position in support of the current proposal. While the revised version still does not fully repeal Obamacare, we are prepared to support it to keep our promise to the American people to lower #healthcare costs. We look forward to working with our Senate colleagues to improve the bill. Our work will continue until we fully repeal Obamacare.  Please know that I remain committed to getting this done. My goals throughout this entire process have always been 1) to bring #premiums down for all Americans, and 2) protect the most vulnerable. I will keep working until we accomplish both of those goals.  And for those asking, the portion about members of Congress being exempt from the bill is being stripped out through an amendment. I will not vote for any bill that gives me a special exemption that my constituents do not get.

LIVE: Secretary Zinke and Department of Interior announce the release of $4 million owed to Swain County, NC as a part of the "Road to Nowhere" dispute

Today I was honored to join Secretary Ryan Zinke of the Department of Interior, Senator Thom Tillis, and the Swain County Board of Commissioners for a special announcement of a promise finally kept.  As you may know, for the last 7 years, the federal government has owed Swain County $39.2 million as a part of the "Road to Nowhere" settlement (a dispute that has dated back to WWII), and as expected, the county has run into all kinds of problems getting their money that they deserve.  In June of this year, I introduced a bill to require the government to pay $35.2 million of the settlement, but due to various restrictions, we would be about $4 million short. Secretary Zinke then stepped up, agreed to cut through the red tape, and announced he would release the remaining $4 million from the Department of Interior--putting Swain County on track to get their full funding.  This was special to be a part of--now Swain County is on track to getting the full allotment of money owed to them. I want to thank Secretary Zinke for his incredible willingness to work with us, Senator Tillis for his efforts, and the Swain County Board for the countless hours they poured into this issue. I'm thrilled to see this happen and am hopeful we can close the deal on the full funding soon!  You can read my full press release here: https://meadows.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/rep-meadows-statement-on-swain-county-funding

Message from NC.gov on #HurricaneIrma safety preparedness:   You and your family members may not be in the same place when an emergency happens. It is important to plan ahead and talk about what you will do before, during and after an emergency. You need to talk about how will you get to a safe place, get in touch with each other and get back to each other.  https://www.ready.gov/sites/default/files/FamEmePlan_2012.pdf  Your plan should contain: • Phone numbers of a pre-assigned contact person for family members to call • List of where to find information on shelters (television, radio, this website, ReadyNC mobile app) • How to be safe if you stay in your home during an emergency • What to do with your pets • Thoughts about any older adults or those with functional needs in the home  Mold your plans for your family’s needs. Think about creating a group of neighbors, friends or family to help each other in emergencies. Talk how that group can help each other connect, care for children, pets or other needs.  Knowing how you will respond to an emergency at home, school or work will help you remain calm, think clearly and react well. Being ready helps you and your family. It also lowers the workload of fire fighters, police and emergency medical workers.
